issue.title: map<Key, T>::value_type does not satisfy the assignable requirement

blockquote.p:
expression return type pre/post-condition
------------- ----------- -------------------
X::value_type T
T is assignable
A map satisfies all the requirements of a container.
For a map<Key, T> ... the value_type is pair<const Key, T>.

discussion.p: There's a contradiction here. In particular, `pair<const Key, T>' is not assignable; the `const Key' cannot be assigned to. So, map<Key, T>::value_type does not satisfy the assignable requirement imposed by a container.
discussion.note: See issue for the slightly related issue of modification of set keys.

rationale.p: The LWG believes that the standard is inconsistent, but that this is a design problem rather than a strict defect. May wish to reconsider for the next standard.
